fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45430].
  {panel}

I searched the issues and have found related tickets but none of them were addressing my question:

Would it be possible with Git to show all commits from a branch related to an issue in the Source tab?
It only seems to aggregate commits if the commit message includes the PROJECT-#### issue ID pattern

We follow that convention only with branch names and while that works fine and links the branch in Stash to the issue on the Development dash and the other way around, both the Development dash and the Source tab only shows commits the messages of which explicitly refer to the issue.

I understand it may not be trivial/feasible to collect commits that from a certain branch. I was thinking of something like _git log PROJECT-1234-the-branch --not <all the other branches>_

Thanks!
fields.summary: Source tab to show commits based on branch name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45429].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an admin with a project containing 18000 issues, when I enable or disable the Issue Security for the project I often get a timeout.
h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if I got a little progress screen like when doing a reindex or a bulk change to a bunch of issues.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like a progress bar for disabling/enabling issue security

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45428].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Editing properties of a *transition* allows inline editing. When I edit *step* properties within a workflow, I have to delete the existing property and then re-add a similar Key/Value pair.

h5. Suggestion
It would be easier if inline editing were allowed to quickly add new property values as needed.
fields.summary: Make step properties inline editable (like transition properties)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45418].
  {panel}

While you are creating a list using the '#' character and then you press enter, Jira creates automatically the next character(#), but if you reach the bottom of the box, the character is created but the scroll bar doesn't follow the mouse cursor which automatically 'follow' the new character, so you are forced to scroll down manually.

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Create a list using the '#' character.
# Write anything and then press enter until you reach the bottom of the text-box.
# When you reach the bottom and press enter, the '#' is created and the mouse cursor goes to its side(follow), but the scroll bar continues in the penultimate '#' character.
fields.summary: The Scroll Bar doesn't follow the mouse cursor while using the '*' and '#' list
Separate Administrator Role and Project Management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45414].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Every time when creating or editing an issue, a notification email will be sent out to the relevant configured individuals. This could at times, when performing high number of issue creations or issue editions, flood the relevant users email.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a checkbox in the Create and Edit screen, which would allows users the option of if they want to send the email notification or not.
fields.summary: As a user, when creating or editing issues, I want an option on whether or not to send a notification email for the action

h3. Summary
After JIRA 7 implementation some bugs were rise created as:
# [JRA-44848|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44848]
# [JRA-44821|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44821]
# [JRA-44834|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44834]
In response, innovalog has reported:
{quote}I believe I have actually identified the issue, but I now need Atlassian's help to fix it. Atlassian broke their "contract" by sometimes replacing usernames in the History table with a string that matches neither the username nor the user Key of an existing user.{quote}


h3. Environment
# JIRA Cloud
# JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a post function to copy the value from an User Picker (multiple users) field to Assignee
# Try transitioning the issue, it will fail

h3. Expected Results
Assignee changes

h3. Actual Results

 
h3. Notes
[innovalog ticket|https://innovalog.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/6/JMWE-379]
fields.summary: Auto assign NOT working for one specific user in the cloud version of JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45404].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have a JIRA Agile Scrum project running
# Set your close transition to use "Resolve Issue" screen
# Transition any issue to the close status
# The Resolve issue screen will show up
# Fill out the assignee to other user
# Type "aaa" on the time spent (just to show some error on the screen) and hit resolve
# Go back and type "1m" on the time spent and hit resolve

*Expected Results:*
The issue will be marked as resolved and the assignee will be the one you set on step 5.

*Actual Results:*
The issue is marked as resolved *but* the assignee is set to myself instead of the one set on step 5.

*Workaround:*
Before hitting resolve for the second time, make sure to re-type the chosen assignee.

*Add-on Version:*
JIRA v7.0.0-OD-05-005
JIRA Agile v7.0.2-D20150904T042837

*Notes:*
The problem does not happen if you type everything correct on the first time.
This only happens if you face any error when filling out the information on the screen.
fields.summary: "Assignee" field won't retain value when resolving issue faces a problem

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45402].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
When a user sets multiple Workflows in a Workflow scheme for a project with each associated with a different issue type as [described here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-workflow-schemes-302809197.html], when they create an issue, the option to Select issue type shows all Issue Types.
When however they go to the view issue screen and try to change the issue type, the option available to them are only those Issue Types associated with that particular Workflow.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a couple of Workflows and associate each to specific set issue types.
#- For example Bugs and suggestions only. 
# Associate the Workflows with a Workflow Scheme and associate this with a project.
# Create an issue and select Bug.
# In the View issue screen(if you have the issue type field in edit scree), attempt to change the issue type.

*Expected Result*
All issue types are available for selection.

*Actual Result*
Only issue types associated with that workflow are available.

*Workaround*
Use the move issue feature found under more to change the issue type to other issue types.
fields.summary: JIRA should show all available issue Types rather than those available to a particular issue Type when editing the issue in View issue Screen
Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Development Integration Plugin
Number of Fields to be configurable in Issue Navigator
Add official support to the usage of a different schema on Oracle

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45386].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On Page:
- https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis

The Wording under the Distribution column for *JIRA REST APIs* notes:
{quote}
JIRA Cloud / JIRA Server (EAP)2
{quote}

The way this is worded looks as though it could have two possible meanings and is not clear to end users:
- JIRA Cloud instances and JIRA Server as (EAP) separately
-- JIRA Cloud
-- JIRA Server (EAP)
- JIRA Cloud instances and JIRA server both as (EAP)
-- JIRA Cloud (EAP)
-- JIRA Server (EAP)

The Correct meaning Should clearly state thes two options are Separately identified

h3. Suggested Solution
Word as:
{quote}
JIRA Server (EAP) and JIRA Cloud
{quote}

OR

Add in an additional column for Server EAP and Cloud respectively
fields.summary: Confusing wording on JIRA APIs documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45372].
  {panel}

When creating a issue in JIRA, we sometime need to choose date like due date by date picker. 

Currently we have no way to know when are non-operational days like national holidays on the picker. Nice to have we can set non-operation days on the picker and these days are highlighted in the calendar like this.
http://dynarch.com/jscal/#sec9
!highligated-dates.png|thumbnail!

My suggestion:
Administrator is able to set array of date in [Advanced JIRA configration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/changing-the-due-date-input-format-192536.html].

ex) 
Property: jira.date.picker.java.holidays
Value: 20090501, 20090502, 20090503

And users know when are non-available days and avoid setting these day as due date.
fields.summary: Want to highlight non-operation days in JIRA date picker

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45371].
  {panel}

See my [question here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/22653271].

h1. Case 1 - Arrays (copied)
Most of the standard custom fields that JIRA ships have meta data that says they are arrays with string values. That normally means you need to provide a JSON array of option ids. Cascade select is a odd case even though it reports the same schema but needs to be handled differently. It has historically been an odd case (wink).  

The trouble is for an arbitrary custom field that reports meta data as "array" and with items of "string" there doesn't seem to be a way to know the format or content of the data that is expected to set the value of the field. Am I missing something here? One would assume meta data would give you enough information to determine that, but it doesn't. Providing an array of values results in an error. How does one create a representation of data for an arbitrary custom field that represents itself as accepting array values but does not? Also, what indication is there that it needs option ids instead of regular strings? This seems like an omission from the metadata available.

For instance, the agile custom fields look like arrays, but don't accept array values:

schema": {
"type": "array",
"items": "string",
"custom": "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-epic-link",
"customId": 11261
}, 

customfield_11261": "ZAGILE-1",

h1. Case 2 - 3rd party custom fields
Here is a Tempo field with the following metadata:
{noformat}
"customfield_10600":{"required":true,"schema":{"type":"account","custom":"com.tempoplugin.tempo-accounts:accounts.customfield","customId":10600},"name":"Account","hasDefaultValue":false,"operations":["set"]},
{noformat}

This happens to be a numeric field. However, there is no indication of that in the metadata. 
Worse, an update using a string value gives "not numeric" error even though the string value is actually a numeric value. There doesn't appear to be a generic way to determine that a numeric is required. The only obvious way is magically knowing about this specific custom field requires a numeric entry.
fields.summary: REST API issue metadata is not complete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45361].
  {panel}

There are two issues reported related to this, JRA-16595 & JRA-39112, but I thought I'd put a general suggestion that encompasses the whole problem.

h3. Problem
As long as the user has create issue permission in a project, they can move an issue to it and more importantly, to ANY workflow state in the target workflow. This creates an issue in a use case such as:

-If you are using in a project (or specific issue type) a workflow that has specific restrictions as it is being used in a strict approval process. The ability to use the move issue operation to "bypass" any workflow conditions and validators renders the approval workflow useless. (not saying that someone would necessarily maliciously seek to do so)

-Similarly, it could be moving to a different issue type within the same project that is using a different workflow as well. 

Looking at the consequences mentioned in the other linked issues, simply put, the "move issue" operation is one could say "too powerful" as it doesn't respect workflow conditions and permissions in the target project.

h3. Solution

Removing create issue permissions to a project or move issue permissions is in a lot of cases not really an option and therefore not a solution.

What would be a solution apart from all conditions and permissions being taken account by the code, would be the ability to disable moving TO a project/issue type either via permission or otherwise so that at least any really problematic cases can be avoided.

h3. Workarounds?

At least for my case I am looking at whether it is impossible to employ a hack to remove certain projects or issue types from the ui dialogue similar to https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=301663662.
fields.summary: The move issue operation should respect workflow restrictions and permissions in target project or issue type.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45360].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Development Integration Panel is not displayed, because the Development Integration Plugin is disabled

h3. Notes
!disabled_plugin.png|thumbnail!

h3. Cause:
The "Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Development Integration Plugin" now requires "JIRA Bamboo Plugin" that is disabled on the instance so it fails to load.

h3.Workaround
Please create a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com with the preferable time to restart JIRA.
It will take 10 to 15 minutes of downtime.

h3. Update:
All sites will be fixed after next scheduled [Maintenance window|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Maintenance+windows].
fields.summary: Development Integration Panel not displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45354].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If the user opens the Issue Creation dialog (and probably other dialogs/screens with an user selector) and opens the dropdown in 'Assign Issue' multiple times, every time the number of users is duplicated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 15-20 users in JIRA 6.5-OD-07, ensure all of them are able to be assigned issues (you need enough users to cause the user list in the Assign Issue dialog to have to scroll).
# Create a new JIRA issue.
# Click Assign, then hit the dropdown arrow in the Assignee field.
# Scroll down (using the keyboard or trackpad/mouse, it doesn't matter) to the bottom of the 
list
# Close the dropdown
# Repeat steps 3 to 5 a few times

h3. Expected Result
The list of users is constant

h3. Actual Results
Every time the user opens the dropdown, the lists of users contains more duplicated users.
fields.summary: Opening the dropdown for "Assign issue" duplicates the number of users in that list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45348].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The name no longer really reflects what it does. What the setting actually does is change the attachment security policy. The default level is a default (secure) attachment level which uses a blacklist of content-types which are sent as attachment downloads, the "insecure" level simply sends all attachments "inline" and the "secure" attachment level sends all attachments as downloads.

h3. Suggested Solution

Rename this something more appropriate as per how the functionality works.
fields.summary: Rename the Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45346].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Attempting to submit feedback via an issue collector using IE11 on Windows 7 fails. The issue is not submitted and the screen remains greyed out.
h3.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to an issue collector in IE 11 (or use the attached index.html containing existing collector embed code)
 # If prompted, elect to "Allow Blocked Content"
 # Click the "Report Feedback" link
 # Fill in the minimum required fields
 # Click the "Submit" button

h3. Expected Results

Issue is submitted and created.
h3. Actual Results

The submit seems to lock up. It never returns from the submit to inform the user that the feedback was submitted.

Using the IE debugger reveals the following failure when the submit is clicked:
SCRIPT5: Access is denied.
File: batch.js, Line: 431, Column: 4108
h3. Notes

The browser is getting an exception in jQuery Form Plugin (v. 2.67 from 2011). 
h3. Workaround

Use another browser.
fields.summary: Issue Collector Fails in IE 11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45340].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If an exception occurs during the processing of a thumbnail (such as a corrupt jpg), JIRA will not record the failure, and the next time the resource is requested, it will generate it (and fail) again.

Typically on those issue that failed due to the condition:
{noformat}
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272460500 2015-09-11 21:24:41,267 ajp-nio-127.0.0.104-8009-exec-1063 WARN sysadmin 1283x137820x1 t77wfs 202.68.74.170,104.192.141.33 /browse/DD-108 [c.a.j.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager] Error writing to thumbnail file: /data/jirastudio/jira/home/data/attachments/TEST/10000/TEST-108/thumbs/_thumb_45662.png1391332809470942590.tmp
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272467500 com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.AttachmentReadException: Remote blobstore couldn't provide an input stream for attachment 45662: java.awt.image.RasterFormatException: (y + height) is outside of Raster
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272795500 	at sun.awt.image.ByteInterleavedRaster.createWritableChild(ByteInterleavedRaster.java:1248)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272796500 	at sun.awt.image.ByteInterleavedRaster.createChild(ByteInterleavedRaster.java:1208)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272797500 	at com.twelvemonkeys.imageio.plugins.jpeg.JPEGImageReader.readImageAsRasterAndReplaceColorProfile(Unknown Source)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272800500 	at com.twelvemonkeys.imageio.plugins.jpeg.JPEGImageReader.read(Unknown Source)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272800500 	at com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.Thumber.scaleImage(Thumber.java:231)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272800500 	at com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.Thumber.createThumbnail(Thumber.java:291)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272812500 	at com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.Thumber.retrieveOrCreateThumbNail(Thumber.java:270)
{noformat}

h3. Expected Result

This should be tracked even in the event of catastrophic failure (such as OOME taking down the application), and thus the attempt should be recorded and committed before the attempt, not after.

When it fails, it should disable the thumbnail from being generated again by marking {{thumbnailable}} on the {{fileattachment}} table to 0

h3. Actual Result

It will take a very long time to load the issue, and fail the page load. Multiple reload will still hit into the same issue. Potential piling up the memory if it keeps loaded.

h3. Workaround

Identify from the error message which image is causing the error, for example in the above error it is image id 45662. Shut down JIRA, take a backup of the database and then run:

{noformat}
update fileattachment set thumbnailable = 0 where id in (<image ids you identified above>)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Failing to generate a thumbnail should remember that the operation failed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45339].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Using the basic screen, select due date, and then select the "now overdue" option. The JQL that is auto-generated is set to >=0. This gives you issues that are due "today", when actually I'm only interested in things that are due before today.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the query 'Overdue' do show issues from one day before.

h3. Workaround 
Use the advance search and edit the query.
fields.summary: Due Data 'Overdue' shouldn't bring issues from the day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45331].
  {panel}

h3. ***Summary***
The JIRA Dashboard Gadget often has issues with contents being cut off and not displayed properly.

h3. ***Improvement Request***
There should be an option to let gadgets be resized automatically to display all contents or set the dimensions of the gadget.
fields.summary: Content Wrap for Dashboard Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45328].
  {panel}

Here's a fairly obtuse bug:

# Start a new, clean search
# Add two issue types to the search where one of them isn't available in all projects (e.g., in the QA data, choose "Book Request" and "Bug")
# Now, choose a project where one of those issue types isn't present and there are no matching issues (no such project exists by default in the QA data; create a new empty project)
# Save the filter
# Create a new issue in that project
# Refresh the filter

Issues won't appear in the detail view. If you click through to the List View, the issue will appear, then if you click back to the Detail view, they will.

Weirdly finnicky. Not sure if my steps are accurate enough.
fields.summary: Odd behaviour with saved filters
"View Watchers" broken with long list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45322].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Currently, on the Create screen, the project field gets pre-populated with the project that was last accessed.

h5. Suggestion
As a JIRA user, it would more convenient in dealing with multiple projects, different ones on separate browser windows/tabs, when clicking on the Create button the Project field gets pre-populated with the project that is associated with the page/url where the click occurred.
Please consider implementing this change or make it an optional config that can be easily turned on/off.
fields.summary: Create Screen: How Project Field Gets Pre-populated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h5. Summary
JIRA users can not vote on issues via e-mail.

h5. Suggestion
Implement the ability to vote on an issue via e-mail.
fields.summary: Ability to vote on an Issue via e-mail

h3. Summary
When clicking on *Maintenance Schedule* at the bottom of the page returns a _Page Not Found_ error (see screenshots).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into your Cloud site
# Click on *Maintenance Schedule* at the bottom of the page.

h3. Expected Results
It would direct you to the correct page.

h3. Actual Results
It returns _Page Not Found_

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
User would like to have a pop up screen with major know issue , just like in JIRA support web . 

!2015-09-10 10_43_38-Submit a problem report to us - JIRA Support - Service Desk.png|width=500!

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide custom screen configuration with fixed text or grab information from issue .

Admin needs to find all users that ave not logged in a while and who those who have not logged in in a while.

*Expected Result*
Add a feature that allows admin filter users based on when last the logged in or those who are inactive.
fields.summary: Add functionality that allows Admin find all Inactive users.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45316].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The upcoming JIRA 7 is no longer supporting Oracle 11g as mentioned in this page :
* [End of support for Oracle 11G|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/end-of-support-announcements-for-jira-210239517.html#EndofSupportAnnouncementsforJIRA-201502ORACLE11.2]

 But Crowd does not support Oracle 12c as mentioned in :
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Supported+Platforms

h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA 7 should support Oracle 11g
fields.summary: Support Oracle 11g for of JIRA 7 since Crowd does not support Oracle 12c
Hovering Mouse Over Versions Doesn't Show Released/Unreleased
Create issue no longer populates the issue history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45301].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Today in the https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Issue-level+Security documentation, there is nothing saying the project will assume its permissions in case you don't set an Issue Security to it. Also, the information appearing there can lead the user to think that all issues are available for anyone:

!issue_security.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an extra information in our documentation mentioning the Project Permission will be considered in case there is no Issue Security set to it.
This information in the Issue Security screen would be great as well.
fields.summary: Add an extra information in the Issue Security documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45300].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Today, when we don't have an Issue Security enabled in a project, the it shows the "Anyone" text on the top:

!issue_security.png|thumbnail!

And since there is no Issue Security, the permissions to access the project/issues will be defined by the project's permissions.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can change this message (or add a more detailed information), since it can lead the users to think that anyone has access to the issues from that specific project.
fields.summary: Change Issue Security Information
Warning notifcation when creating a clone ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45297].
  {panel}

h2.Summary
Project Picker custom fields are not working in Issue Navigator search. When clicking on the drop down list; the list is empty and when attempting to click on the empty list; error is returned.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create a new custom field of type Project Picker
# Create a new issue stating some value to the custom field
# Include the new custom field to the Issue Navigator JQL search
# Try to specify the value for the field.

h2.Expected Result
* List of projects returned.

h2.Current Result
* No project is returned. Only a long white list and when you attempt to click on the white list, it shows no project name as the screenshot below:

!first.jpg|thumbnail!

!second.JPG|thumbnail!

h2. Workaround

Using Advance Searching instead. 
{code}
"Project Picker Custom Field Name" = <Project Name>
{code}

h2. Addition Observation

When switching to Advance Search, defined the Project for the search and returns to Basic Search, it is seen to have some weird values on the values field, {{$valueObject.getString('name')}}

!Screen Shot 2015-09-28 at 4.19.42 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Project Picker custom field not working in Issue Navigator search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45296].
  {panel}

h3. Issue Summary
If a user sends an email to JIRA and the email contains an inline image, the image is attached as an attachment rather than being a part of the main comment from the email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a project in JIRA
* Configure incoming email for the project
* Send an email that contains an inline image to the project so it creates an issue.

h3. Expected Result
Image appears as it is with the email that was sent.

h3. Actual Result
Image added as an attachment to the issue rather than being part of the comment(embedded in the comment).

h3. Current Way it Works
If the user adds the correct wiki markup for image in the email, the image is attached in the comment correctly.

h3. Suggested solution
JIRA should scan the email and should it notice an image in the incoming mail, replace the section with the email with an appropriate wiki Markup.

h3. Workaround
Insert the image to the email, then use the wiki markup on the email body so that clients get the email properly. 

+Add the attachment from email:+
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail! 

+View the attachments from comment:+
 !screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow Inline Images from Incoming Email appear in JIRA

fields.description:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45289].
  {panel}

Hello All

When user assigned issue to somebody,  event "Issue Commented" is not raised.
As a result, users who have subscribed to the "Issue Commented" event do not receive their email notification.

Would it be possible to raise event "Issue Commented" as soon as an Assignee changed along with a comment?

Thanks in advance
fields.summary: Assigning issue with comment do not rise "Issue Commented" Event
Remove the header highlight background  color only on JIRA logo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45269].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
In JIRA, if a user is created and the option to send a notification to such a user is not checked, it would be difficult to notify the user again.

*Usage Scenario*
- Go to {{Admin > User Management}} page.
- Click Create User.
- Do not check the option to {{Send Notification Email}}.
- Create the user.

Now decide to send a notification to the user so they know an account has been created for them.

*Option 1*
- Delete the user.
- Create user again and check the option.

*Option 2*
- Send a personal email to the user and have the user reclaim their username and password using the feature {{Can't access your account?}}

*Preferred Solution*
- Add the option to {{Send Notification Email}} to the modify user feature.
fields.summary: Send Notification to already created users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45267].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When user creating issue from administration page , prompt different create issue screen from the pop up screen . Below is the screenshot  :-

New page create issue screen:-
!Screen Shot 2015-09-08 at 4.16.02 PM.png|width=400!

Pop up create screen:-

!Screen Shot 2015-09-08 at 4.16.24 PM.png|width=400!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Administration page , such as *Screens* page .
# Then , click *Create* to create issue .
# Then , it will go to https://BASE_URL/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa . And the screen is different with create issue pop up screen.
# To test on create issue pop up screen , go to *Dashboard* . Then , click *Create* button . A pop up screen will prompt.

h3. Expected Results
https://BASE_URL/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa , should be the same screen view as pop up screen.
!Screen Shot 2015-09-08 at 4.16.24 PM.png|width=400!

h3. Actual Results
Screen only contains *Project* and *Issue Type* fields.
!Screen Shot 2015-09-08 at 4.16.02 PM.png|width=400!
fields.summary: When creating Issue from Administration Page prompt different create issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45265].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, when releasing a version, users will have the option to move unresolved issues to another version. It would be nice if there was an additional option to Resolve/Close all currently unresolved issues 

h3. Suggestion
Add another option to Resolve/Close all unresolved issues when releasing a version
fields.summary: Option to Close all related issues when releasing a version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45264].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At description field , Text formating for creating table is not working properly . New line get indented after bullet list . Below is the screenshot :-

*Scenario 1*

After insert a new line after bullet list , the new line get indented.
!Screen Shot 2015-09-07 at 10.04.25 PM.png|width=500!
!Screen Shot 2015-09-07 at 10.04.34 PM.png|width=400!

*Scenario 2*

After insert a new line with a space after bullet list , the new line get out from the table box.
!Screen Shot 2015-09-07 at 10.04.55 PM.png|width=500!
!Screen Shot 2015-09-07 at 10.05.06 PM.png|width=400!

h3. Suggested Solution
New line should be working in the table text format .
fields.summary: Issues with wiki markup table cell rendering, when a new line follows a bullet list
Update https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Automating+JIRA+Backups for JIRA 6.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45256].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary
When a project is deleted in JIRA, various configurations as well as users remain in it hence achieving a full clean delete is difficult.

For example, if I restore a backup but require just one project, if I delete all the other projects, settings such as permission scheme, configuration scheme, Workflows and users are still left in the system.

The feature we would like implemented would be able to delete all of these when the project is deleted.

*Suggestion*:
As most schemes can be shared, a notification should be shown when user attempts to delete a project that has such a shared scheme and the user would be allowed to confirm this.
If they confirm it, revert all such settings back to the default schemes for them.
fields.summary: Allow full project delete.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45255].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, even though users install a language pack, they are still required to use *m*, *h* and *w* when logging work. Some languages have their own alphabets (eg. Russian)

h3. Suggestion
Have a complete translation which includes singular alphabets when logging work
fields.summary: Translate Work Log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45251].
  {panel}

*Summary*
JIRA needs to be able to export 'Versions' only

*Details*
Currently we don't have the feature that could achieve the 'Version' export to any kind of format (excel, etc). One of my customer asked this feature to help him to do some reporting in the company.

*Workaround*
Unfortunately, we do not have any workaround for this moment
fields.summary: JIRA needs to be able to export 'Versions' only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45250].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* The default *Order By* for the issue navigator on the Project view page is set to 'Priority' and this cannot be changed. 
* Please refer to the screenshot below on the top right, the Order By is by default set to Priority and even after changing it to something else for example, 'Created' , once the page is refreshed, the Order By will go back to 'Priority' 
!priority.png|thumbnail!
* The problem also occurs in the view "all issues" (the table that comes when clicking the link to view all issues).

h3. Suggested Solution
* Introduce the feature to configure or ability to remember the last used Order By
 
h3. Workaround 
* Create a filter and use the filter instead.
fields.summary: Change the default Order By for issue navigator on project view
Automatic reply/notification to the users if their emails are not processed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45248].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
Currently, setting/ configuring the "Time Tracking Settings" is a system wide change and all projects use this same setting.

Can this be made to a project level setting as users might at times want to have different Timing Tracking Settings e.g default should be in hours for project A while it is expected in minutes for project B.

_This is with regards to {{Admin > System > Time Tracking}} feature_
fields.summary: Time Tracking Setting per Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45239].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently using SQL logging in *Administration* > *System* > *Troubleshooting and Support* > *Logging and Profiling* does not enable AO logging by default. It must be enabled in addition to SQL logging.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enhance the button so that it enables logging at the same time.
 
h3. Workaround 

Follow [How to Enable Detailed SQL Logging in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Enable+Detailed+SQL+Logging+in+JIRA].
fields.summary: As an Admin I want SQL Logging to enable Active Objects Logging by Default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45236].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When viewing issue, some users(mostly Administrator/Manager) want to know if there is any other issue raised by the same reporter. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of doing a filter for it, there must be a panel on the view issue webpage where it shows all other related issues. 

h3. Workaround 
There is [Scripted Fields|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/scripted-fields.html] in [ScriptRunner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner] plugin which will be able to retrive the issue IDs and display on the screen while viewing any issue.
*Note*: This is just a suggestion, never tested before.
fields.summary: Ability to see issue created by the reporter when viewing the issue

fields.description:
Jira does not currently allow me to update my base url to: jira.mvoice-office

This dns address is resolvable from both the laptop I am using to access Jira and also on the Jira server itself.

I have temporarily change this to just: jira as the default search domain is mvoice-office but this causes problems with the application links to bamboo and stash
fields.summary: Unable to update base url
Confluence page is having error  : Error formatting macro: snippet: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 20, Size: 20

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45228].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

* Currently, the only configuration for thumbnails is Enable or Disable. 
* If you need to define an image as a thumbnail in a comment, you also have to use the "! !" parameters.
* As an Admin that works based on images on tickets, the lack of customizations is troublesome.

h3. Suggested Solution

* Options to improve the settings of a thumbnail would be great for customers that rely on them.
* That could include:
** Resizing of the thumbnails
** Option to make it default on comments
fields.summary: Expand cusomization options for Thumbnails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45227].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When accessing a dashboard with gadgets that depends on filters that the user does not have access to, the error message is misleading and does not reflect the true nature of the problem:
{quote}*Unfortunately, one or more of your preferences are now unavailable. Please update your preferences, or remove gadget by clicking delete from the title bar above.*
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a private (not shared) filter;
 # Add a *Pie Chart* gadget to a shared Dashboard;
 # Use the private filter on the *Pie Chart* gadget;
 # Access this dashboard as another user.

h3. Expected Results

An error mentioning the user is unable to view the filter or project would be displayed as in JIRA 6.3.15:
!jira6315.png!
h3. Actual Results

The following error is displayed:
!jira6411.png!
h3. Notes
 # The problem is simply that the user viewing the gadget does not have permission to view the filter.
 # The problem will happen if any field values was missing from the filter.

h3. Workaround
 * Note 1: Grant the user the necessary permission to view the filters used by the affected gadgets.
 * Note 2: Remove the missing field values from the filter.
fields.summary: Regression JRA-17411 - Misleading error when accessing Dashboards without permission to see gadgets' filters

fields.description:
When I run the query 'created <= '2015-09-04' it does not include any JIRAs created on 2015-09-04. Less than or equal to is acting like less than, when it should be including the specified date. 

When I run the query 'created > '2015-09-03' it is including any JIRAs created on 2015-09-03. Greater than is acting like greater than or equal to, when it should be excluding the specified date.

This is affecting all of our reporting that we run in JIRA
fields.summary: operators <= (Less than or equal to) and > (greater than) are not working properly with dates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Thanks!

Show number of issues in project when deleting a project.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45214].
  {panel}

If one user has New Project Navigation enabled and tries to give certain URLs to another user with New Project Navigation _disabled_ then, when the other user tries to navigate to that URL, the web browser returns a 404 error.

Example: 
* New Project Navigation: https://jira.mumms.com/projects/HB/versions/12594
* Old Project Navigation: https://jira.mumms.com/browse/HB/fixforversion/12594

These URLs both point to the same data, but only one will return a page depending on the User Preference settings.
fields.summary: New vs Old Project Navigation URL parity broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45213].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Some users are finding the new 'Add a Gadget' experience in JIRA a little confusing:

* On the initial screen there is an error: "Were still trying to fetch..." rather than "We're still trying to fetch..."
* There is no progress indicator is shown to indicate that JIRA is still loading gadgets
* It's not immediately obvious that the message to the right changes
* It's not clear that the 'load all gadgets' link is a link that needs to be clicked

h3. Suggested Solution
* Fix the error, and display a progress spinner on the initial window
* Make it clearer that the loading process is complete
* Make it clearer that 'load all gadgets' is something that needs to be pressed

h3. Additional Information

* Initial dialog with error, also not showing any loading indicator:
!gadgets-1.png|thumbnail!

* Second diaglog, note it is very similar to the first dialog so it's not immediately clear the text has changed and that it is now necessary to click the link:
!gadgets-2-updated.png|thumbnail!

* Final resulting dialog with all gadgets loaded
!gadgets-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The new Add a Gadget experience in JIRA is a little confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45211].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

During bulk operations that change a field, sometime we want to keep the current field value if it meets certain criteria.  For a group of issues where we provide a new value for a field, we want to only change the field value if it does not already meet the field criteria.

Example: In a collection of issues some are Resolved with a value for Resolution.  Others in the collection are not yet resolved.  We want to change all the issues statuses to Resolved but only change the Resolution if it has not already been populated.

h3. Suggested Solution

When entering new field values for the bulk operation, provide an optional text input where a JQL expression can be entered.  Issues that match this JQL filter will receive the new field value, otherwise the existing field value will not be modified.
 
h3. Workaround 

Split the result collection into two or more groups using JQL queries.  Perform the desired changes on each of these smaller groups of issues as appropriate.
fields.summary: Ability to conditionally update field values during bulk operations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45210].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If you set a group to have a project permission, Permission Helper says that the user do not have the project permission, but the user do have the permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new user 
# Create a new group 
# Create a new project
# Create a new issue
# Make sure the user belongs only to the new group and jira-users.
# Add the group to have the project permission "Browse Project".
# Open the Project Roles and remove the group jira-users of the Project Role users.
#* This is to make sure that the user is only given permission through groups not project roles.
# Open the permission helper and inform the user and issue that you just created.
#  Select "Browse Projects" and Submit

h3. Expected Results

The permission helper correctly identifies the user is in that group and that they belong to that project permission, and they have permissions.

h3. Actual Results

Permission helper says "The user do not have 'Browse Project' permission".

h3. Workaround

Set the permission to project roles instead of groups or user. We highly recommend project roles are used over groups for permissions as it means one permission scheme can be applied to multiple projects.
fields.summary: Permission Helper does not recognize groups or single users in Project Permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45207].
  {panel}

I ran this:

{noformat}
$ curl -I https://jira.ourdomain.com/browse/PJ-9999999
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Thu, 03 Sep 2015 20:03:35 GMT
Server: Apache/2.4.10 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.0.1j mod_jk/1.2.35
X-AREQUESTID: 963x1648935x1
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
X-ASEN: SEN-2256593
Set-Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=BKZ1-7LHA-354G-7V07|9060353149b058ceb1949adc6eca996f54b9cf62|lout; Path=/; Secure
X-AUSERNAME: anonymous
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=5577533B7E679C8F53B41531F81F3442; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
X-Accel-Buffering: no
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
{noformat}

The issue _PJ-9999999_ does not exist.  I would expect something like a 400/406 to come back.  This is *extremely* useful for simple scripting purposes.
fields.summary: invalid jira entry ID in URL should something other than 200 HTTP response code

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45200].
  {panel}

* Search for issues based on a query
* Save the query
* Customize columns for the saved filter.
* Click on Columns and select the fields that needs to be displayed.

Problem:
* Not all of the fields are displayed for the end user.
* "start typing to see more values" is the option given to the user for adding additional columns.
* Users may or may not know the field names to type and they may not know all the available fields. 
* For example, in order to show the "Issue Links", a user had to start typing "i" (no result), then "c" (children/clone - no result) and then "l" for links. They get the field that they want by trial and error.

It would be nice if all the fields are displayed to the user when they click on "More" link (similar to the Component choices)
fields.summary: Problem with Configuration of Issue Table Columns
Duplicate Labels Regardless of Case Sensitivity

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Steps to the problem
1. Login as  sysadmin from hal
2. Access Dark feature page directly via 
https://il51.jira-dev.com/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures.jspa

Actual behavior

Expected behavior
Sysadmin can be able to manage dark features of their instances.

Environment:
OD dev instance
fields.summary: Always lead to XSRF page when sysadmin tries to access Dark feature page
